storage

Class AbstractField

  • java.lang.Object
    • storage.AbstractField
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanField, CharField, DateField, IntegerField, RealField, VarcharField

    public abstract class AbstractField
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class for classes representing specific types of fields.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractField()

      • isNamed

        public boolean isNamed(java.lang.String n)
        Checks if the field has the specified name.
        Parameters:
        n - string which may be the same as the field name
        Returns:
        True iff n is the same (case insensitively) as the field name.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int width)
        Returns a string representation of the name and type of the field formatted for a table.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the field column of the table the output is to be formatted for
        Returns:
        the name and type of the field

      • toXML

        public java.lang.String toXML()
        Returns an XML representation of the field describing its name and type
        Returns:
        an XML representation of the field

      • insert

        public abstract void insert(java.lang.String input,
          java.io.RandomAccessFile dataRAF,
          java.io.RandomAccessFile varDataRAF)
                     throws DatabaseException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Writes the datum represented by input to the provided files
        Parameters:
        input - String which describes a datum of this field's type
        dataRAF - File to which to write fixed length data
        varDataRAF - File to which to write variable length data
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if input does not correctly describe a datum of the field's type
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing to a file

        Gets the name of the field

                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               DatabaseException
        Returns a string representation of the item at pointed at by dataFile
        Parameters:
        dataRAF - file containing the fixed length data of a file
        varDataRAF - file containing the variable length data of a file
        Returns:
        the next item in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem reading a file
        DatabaseException

      • readValue

        public abstract AbstractValue readValue(java.io.RandomAccessFile dataRAF,
                      java.io.RandomAccessFile varDataRAF)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a value of this field's type read from the given files and sets the file pointer of dataRAF to its original value
        Parameters:
        dataRAF - file containing the fixed length data of the table with its file pointer one byte into a row
        varDataRAF - file containing the variable length data of the table
        Returns:
        a value read from the files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem reading a file

      • parseValue

        public abstract AbstractValue parseValue(java.lang.String valueString)
                                  throws DatabaseException
        Returns a value of this field's type represented by valueString
        Parameters:
        valueString - string representation of the value
        Returns:
        the value represented by valueString
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if valueString does not correctly describe a value of this fields type

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String valueString,
          java.io.RandomAccessFile dataRAF,
          java.io.RandomAccessFile varDataRAF)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   DatabaseException
        Sets the field to valueString in the row pointed to by dataRAF and sets its file pointer to its original value
        Parameters:
        valueString - value to which the field is to be set
        dataRAF - file containing the fixed length data of the table with its file pointer one byte into a row
        varDataRAF - file containing the variable length data of the table
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem accessing a file
        DatabaseException - if valueString does not correctly describe a datum of the field's type
